intro: Sticherus inflexus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sticherus, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive leaf structure with a narrow, elongated shape and a smooth, glossy surface. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are borne on short stalks and contain the spores necessary for propagation. Sticherus inflexus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
